getgearrough: Toss out your weapons and I won't rough you up.

win: Justice has been served to the old House gang.

e: He had a jaw harp in his pocket!
Maybe they killed him for playing the jaw harp too much.

popup: The remains of a group of outlaws, tragically killed by a giant spider.
There's a tattooed tooth in one of the skulls.
take: It comes out real easy like.  The spider venom must've loosened things up.
Also, though the rest of the bones are picked clean, the gang's stripey hats lie nearby.  Apparently even the spider was disgusted by them.  You take one.

Cavern Canyon Bar - Behind the Bar

win: You put an end to the Stripey Hat Gang's reign of bad taste.

You also take one of those horrible hats, as a souvenir.

start: There are quite a few good books on here, actually!

popup: Going through Chuck's drawers seems like maybe not a good idea.
There is a key on top of the dresser, though.

take: You sling the sack of mail over your shoulder. Neither rain nor sleet nor super-creepy B&B proprietors.

start: You see Louise Lathrop busily baking bread.  Billy Baker hops to his feet as you enter.
Hey! Thanks for sending Louise over! She knows a ton about baking!
Yeah! We're gonna be major league bakers with her around!
No problem, fellas. Let me grab enough bread to settle things with the Mayor, and we'll call it square.

yesgrain: The Baker Boys sneak out to Kellogg Ranch to filch a few bags of grain.
After a couple tries, the boys hit on a decent bread recipe, and bake enough to cover what they stole from the Mayor.
yesbones: The Baker Boys sneak out to the Buffalo Pile and collect a load of bones, which do indeed turn out to make bizarrely effective fertilizer. As in, you can literally watch the wheat growing.
The grain seems fine though, and after a couple tries, the boys hit on a decent bread recipe, and bake enough to cover what they stole from the Mayor.
yesforage: You teach Jerry how to find the wild ingredients they need while Billy works on figuring out a proper recipe.
After a couple tries, they manage to produce a pretty decent loaf of bread, and bake enough to cover what they stole from the Mayor.
yesilldoit: The boys grumble, but they turn over the last remnants of their ingredients, and you manage to get enough bread out of them to satisfy the mayor.
yesilldoit2: The boys grumble, but they turn over the last remnants of their ingredients, and you manage to get enough bread out of them to satisfy the mayor.

e: It wasn't a pillow at all, but a bag of beans!

picklock: The locker contains the key to itself and a few miscellaneous sundries.

prob5: We keep a municipal soup kitchen open to help those who're down on their luck -- which is pretty much everybody 'round here. But we've run out of soup, and need someone to go fetch some more from Soupstock Lode.
He gives you a stack of bread bowls to carry the soup in.
Breadwood Mayor's Office - Soup Quest Accepted

yes: He marks the location of the cemetery on your map.

seven: Boots, great. Boots full of bandit spit. I hope they have to invent a whole new kind of trenchfoot just for you. I hope they name it after you.
You're just jealous of my sweet new boots.

initstore: The woman behind the counter stares at you with a huge grin on her face.
She gestures at the goods she's got for sale.

take: If this doesn't call for a 'yoink!' sound effect, I don't know what does.

grab: The skull was resting on top of a commemorative spoon! Your treasure-hunting senses are finely honed, though not very discriminating.

inv: Amid the other refuse, you find something strange.

finish: You've recovered all of the relics! Oh, praise be! Thank you!
I'm glad to have helped, Sister.
I must reward you for your efforts, though. We don't have much, but you might find this handy? One of our old priests left it behind.
Old Mission - Holy Relic Quest Completed

win: Well done!  Now Santa Cortada's in pieces so small they can't do any harm.

right: Granny's eyes brighten, and she bursts into tears -- but happy ones this time.
Oh yes, of course!  How could I have forgotten?
Poor, sweet Magdalene.  Oh, how I miss her...
Poor, sweet Melissa.  Oh, how I miss her...
Granny drifts over to her tombstone and gently places a bouquet at its base.  Both Granny and the flowers fade away into nothingness.
That is, except for a single flower that remains.

getreward: Great! Whew! That's a load off my mind, let me tell you. Here, you can have this worry-stone, I don't need it now.

get: You pluck the sword from the stone.  Now you're royalty!

inv1: Well, tool singular. There's a shovel here.
grabshovel: You grab the shovel and cram it in your pack.

win: You beat the skeleton and stuff what's left of it back into the gravehole.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.
digt1: The ground here is rocky, and it's pretty hard on your shovel.
Instead of a coffin, you find an urn.  Looks like this soldier was cremated.  Or died in a fire.
You make it down to the coffin and find...  not much to write home about.
digt3: The ground here is rocky, and it's pretty hard on your shovel.
You make it down to the coffin and find a lockbox, which you open.
myco: Plot 420 is completely overgrown with mushrooms.  You root around in the loose shroomage and find a book.
Coincidentally, it's a book about mushrooms!
necrotoken: Next to that tombstone, you find a pile of refuse obviously left behind by one of the Necromancer's cultists.  In addition to being evil meddlers in dark forces best left unmeddled in, those jerks are real litterbugs!
necrobook: Next to that tombstone you find a pedestal with a leather-bound book on top of it.  Looks evil.  You'd better grab it before somebody else does.
postpuzz7: You shake your head, unable to think of something to say.
Say a word for the departed
You say a brief word for the departed.
A courier walks up to you.
According to General Heimer's will, I am supposed to deliver this to the person standing at his grave at this exact moment.
He hands you a package and then departs. You open the box and inside is a bunch of Meat.
You cringe for a second, but he hands you a package and then departs. You open the box and inside is a bunch of Meat.
At the bottom of the package is a note that says, "You've not heard the last from me."
You wait around for a minute, but nothing happens.
You can't shake the feeling General Heimer hasn't had his last word, though.
Say another word for the departed
A courier walks up to you.
According to General Heimer's will, I am supposed to deliver this to the person standing at his grave at this exact moment.
The will is very specific.  And very long.
Alright, let's get this over with.
The courier then knocks you cold with a cudgel.
You feel good about that word, but it feels like maybe you skipped a step or two.
Say another word for the departed
A courier walks up to you.
According to General Heimer's will, I am supposed to deliver this to the person standing at his grave at this exact moment.
He hands you a package and leaves. (Thank goodness!)  You open it and inside is a huge gem.  Nice!
You somehow feel that wasn't quite the right thing to say.

search: You find a key in one of the inside pockets!
Buffalo Pile (Storage/Assembly) - Robe Next to Slab

get: You flip through and find one book relevant to your interests.

takequest2: Great! Here's a list of parts. There's a place called the Buffalo Pile to the east, that's probably your best bet.

skeleton3: This is an owl skeleton.  If you want to know how many fireballs it takes to get to the center of an enemy skeleton, just ask an owl.
bloof,Increase your Spell Damage\nfor the rest of the day
Take a picture of it [Requires the owl camera]

get: You flip that beautiful brass bucket over and slap it onto your head, drenching yourself in hot brown tobacco spit. It washes down over your face and hair like a sewage waterfall, soaking your clothes, running down your collar and slithering into your underwear, and filling your boots. I can't even force myself to describe it in any more detail than that.
You are the world's foulest human being. Congratulations!

dig: You poke around their campsite for a bit, but don't find anything of value apart from the leader's knife and a ticket to the circus. Well, the harmonica maybe, but that clown had his lips all over it. *shudder*

You also find a note (in one of the lead clown's pockets... eww). It seems to be orders to check out an abandoned tannery not far from Dirtwater. It's probably a bad idea to let these guys wander around near town, so maybe you should investigate.
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

start: Howdy there, @miss@! Interest ya in a toy balloon?
How do you make them float like that?
buyit: All righty then! Here you go!

cont11: You bow to the cheering crowd, carefully keeping your eyes on Barnaby Bob. He bows as well, removing his hat with an elaborate flourish, and then he takes a slip of paper out of it.
And as a token of appreciation, I'd like to give our star volunteer a gift: a year's supply of dynamite! Use it in good health!
As he hands you the coupon, the clown leans in close to your ear and whispers:
This was the only warning you'll get, @boy@.
Barnaby Bob waves and blows kisses to the crowd as you climb down from the stage, and then he disappears through the backstage curtain. The audience gradually disperses.

open: The dial looks pretty complex and has weird squiggles instead of numbers. Fortunately, the impact knocked it wide open, so that doesn't matter.
It contains a few scorched and blackened fragments of what you think might be eggshell, and a pretty nice pair of boots that seem undamaged.

popup: "Cotton candy." says the clown behind this food stand. "Come try this... cotton candy."
"Cotton candy!" calls the clown behind this food stand, and then makes a fweeee-oooot! noise with a slide-whistle. "Come try this just-invented confectionary delight!"

start: The clown blows his slide-whistle again as you approach.
Step right up, @miss@. Step up and try one of the world's newest candy ...things.
Fwoooo-eeeet! Step right up, @miss@! Step up and try one of the world's newest candy sensations!
what: Cotton candy. The finest spun sugar, created through a revolutionary new process. It's so light and sweet and fluffy, it's... well, it's really great.

Cotton candy! The finest -- in several senses of the word -- spun sugar, created through a revolutionary new process! It's so light and sweet and fluffy, it's like eating butterfly dreams and kitten wishes! Fwoooooo-eeeeeet!
cotton: So it isn't actually made of cotton?
What? No. Cotton is indigestible, no matter how much chocolate you cover it with.
Found that out the hard way, did you?
...I don't want to talk about it.
invented: No, some dentists down south were the first ones. But after hearing about it, I managed to figure out how it works, pretty much.

Not as such -- couple dentists down south were the first ones. Dentists! Go figure! Fweeeeeeee-oooooot! But after hearing about it, I managed to figure out how it works. Made a few improvements with my design, too!
please: Nope. These secrets in this box are for nobody's eyes but my own. I can sell you some cotton candy, though.
Sorry, @miss@! These secrets in this box are for nobody's eyes but my own! Fweeee-oooot! I'll be happy to sell you some cotton candy, though!
howmuch: Just 300 Meat! ...or my slide-whistle, if you happen to find it. I really miss my slide-whistle.
I'll take one. [Requires 300 Meat or slide-whistle]
You know, I think I saw a slide-whistle...
buy: I found this slide-whistle. Is it yours?
stealwhistle: The clown puts his slide whistle down on the counter and ducks underneath; you quickly snatch the whistle and slip it into your pocket.
front: You quickly shut the box and dart back to the front of the counter just before the clown returns. He gives you a momentary suspicious look, but is quickly distracted by the joy of getting his slide-whistle back.
Fwoooooo-eeeeeeeet! You were right! Thank you so much!

The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the box emits a thin squealing sound as something resembling glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.
paymeat: The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.

The clown ducks under the counter and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.

paywhistle: I found this slide-whistle. Is it yours?
Oh my gosh, it is! Thank you so much!

The clown carefully puts his slide whistle in his shirt pocket, ducks underneath the counter, and comes back up with a paper cone, which he holds in the mouth of the metal box. He pulls down a lever and the machine makes a thin squealing sound as glittering white spun sugar collects around the paper cone in a fluffy cloud.
Here you go, @miss@! It's on the house!

level3: You take careful aim and pop off rounds (and balloons) for as long as you can hold the gun together.
Hey, not bad! Not bad at all! Not enough balloons for our grand prize, but it's worth a li'l something!
He gives you a little toy stuffed cat.
Limit one kitten per customer, though.
level4: I'm not sure exactly how a jaguar shoots, but presumably it's pretty good. You clear nearly the entire wall of balloons, and the clown looks genuinely impressed.
Well I'll be! Looks like you win! Congratulations on the finest shooting I've seen in quite a time!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made toy stuffed cat.

level3: You pick up the mallet, take a deep breath, and smash that lever with a mighty swing. The little bell-striker makes it nearly -- but not quite! -- to the bell.
Well now! That was very close. Not a grand prize winner, but it's the best I've seen today and that's got to be worth something!
He hands you a small teddy bear.
Limit one per customer on the teddy bears, though.
level4: You pick up the mallet, toss it end-over-end and catch it a couple of times to test its weight, and casually slam it into the lever.
Well I'll be! That's some gen-u-ine muscle you've got on you, @fella@! Looks like you're a winner!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made teddy bear.

level3: The clown starts picking cards out of the deck and holding them up with the backs to you. You manage to guess about two-thirds of them.
Say, that's not bad! Not enough to win the grand prize, but you deserve some recognition for that, my friend.
He gives you a little toy stuffed owl.
Limit one per customer on the owls, though.
level4: The clown starts picking cards out of the deck and holding them up with the backs to you. You rattle off their names as fast as he can pick them up. He seems genuinely impressed.
That, @sir@, is so remarkable as to be practically frightening. Looks like we have a winner!
The show will be starting soon, so don't miss it!
showover: He hands you a large and reasonably well-made plush owl.

post: Hello again, @maam@! Thanks for finding my lucky bottle cap!
okay: The kid runs off with his new balloon.

handstamp: The ticket booth clown recognizes you and waves you toward the circus entrance.
The ticket booth clown eyes you warily and waves you through the circus entrance.
The ticket booth clown kind of gives you the stink-eye, but he waves you through the circus entrance anyway.
The ticket booth clown just sort of glares at you.
I'd like to buy another ticket.
buycheckintro: I'd like to buy another ticket.
The clown cocks an eyebrow and looks back and forth between you and @pardnername@.
Only one ticket per person, and I already told you pardners get in free.
Okay, but like, you must have something else I can buy?  I really need to buy something here.
He glances around his stand before bending over, grabbing something from beneath the booth.
Alright look, you could buy this thing?  No idea where it came from or who it belongs to.  You could have it for... let's say 1,000 Meat?
buycheck: You drop the Meat on the booth and he pushes the thing over to you.
Pleasure doing business with you, I guess.

buyfihun: Let me just stamp your hand for re-entry... there you go. Enjoy the show!
buyit: You unload 5,000 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
You unload 7,500 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
You unload 10,000 Meat onto the counter. The clown looks surprised.
Well, uh... okay! I guess you've bought yourself a ticket! Let me just stamp your hand for re-entry... there we go. Enjoy the show!
outfox5: I don't know, this still seems shady to me. I'm pretty sure you're hiding something. Maybe something you wouldn't want the marshals to find out about...
Hey, wow, jeez @mister@! Fine, you win -- look, it's on the house, okay? Just gimme your hand so I can stamp you for re-entry. ...There. Good grief.
Yeah, don't mention it. Literally, do not mention it.
hornswoggle4: That's still outside the normal price range.
Hey, come on, we had to travel a long way to get here, we've got expenses and... stuff.
I would hate to discover that you were hiding anything from me.
Of course not! Of course not. Look, I tell you what, you're a VIP, you get the VIP ticket -- on the house. Lemme just stamp your hand for re-entry... Okay! Enjoy the show!

searchit:
Most of the contents are trashed from being stomped on. You do find a dented can of "potted meat", though.

You also notice that the knapsack has a knife sheath strapped to the side, but you don't see the knife anywhere.

search: You poke around in the tattered shreds of his clothes and find an old key.

cowsbane: It's an herb used for tanning leather. You can't grow it in large batches any more because cows show up and wreck the place, so there's other stuff we generally use for pig leather and so on. It's not as good though.
Yeah, if you're growing more than about a flowerpot's worth, they get wind of it somehow. They hate the stuff. Can't figure why. Here, I've got a few extra seeds you can have. Be careful with them.
Danny's Tannery (St. Rage Shed) - Grady's Cowsbane Seeds
How long have you been in here?
Well, I took care of the clowns and the cows...

win2: Whew, what a mess that fight was. And what a mess the floor is afterward. At least now you're free to poke around the scenery.
You take that nasty clown's knife, and oh look! They also had a key!
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

openit: Besides the miscellaneous scraps and junk that naturally accumulate in toolboxes, you find a handful of nails and a pair of sizeable, sharp, and serious-looking scissors.

iron1: Your mind reaches into the bean iron to see what shapes it conceals.
iron2: The dense bean-iron hides many mysteries.
Well, three.  Three mysteries.  They're good ones, though.
iron3: This delicate bean-iron is flexible.  Versatile.  Complexity upon complexity hides within its structure.
madeall: You've gotten all the value you can out of this material.

leather1: You think about what you could make out of thick leather.
leather2: You consider what you could make out of smoldering leather.
leather3: You ponder what you could make out of infernal leather.
An idea burns in your corrupt mind.  A hammer.
Yes, a hammer [+11 Muscle; Using a bone]
afterskill: A bag [+30% Meat, +20% Item, On Fire]

getpuz: Heh.  He loves stuff like this.

leaving: heirloom,your grandmother's favorite can of beans
heirloom,your grandmother's briefcase full of snakes
Listen, I... want you to have this.  It's $heirloom$.

mom3: Yep!  It's that book you wanted for Crimbo.  I know it's early, but...
The one about picking locks?  Oh boy!
book: The one about picking locks?  Oh boy!

coolbook: Oh hey, this one might come in handy.

start: You lift up the corner of the entire cairn.  There's some kind of machine buried underneath it!
You get the sense you won't need Curly's compass anymore, so you bury it under the cairn.

dig: It's mostly just boring broken bones, but you do find a skull with a weird tag on it...

dig3: You finally manage to reach all the way to the bottom of the bag, and retrieve a sodden lump from the bottom.
You unglob the wad and dry it off, then wash your arm in a nearby ditch.

win: You put a stop to that skeleton's magical dancing.
You help yourself to his sweet knife.
The Daveyard Mausoleum - The Skeleton of Dave B. Defeated
Cow-hate flashes in her eyes.  Her resolve intensifies.

digup: You dig up the grave, just to check the veracity of the epitaph.
Sure enough -- boots but no pants!

digthru: You dig through the rags and find a few things that look like they're worth keeping.

piano2: Hmm... Maybe my info's too old. I found a note from some travelers that passed through here about eight years ago.
Ohhh. Yeah, that was the previous bartender. He had a, uh, a little trick he used to offer to show people. It's what got him fired, eventually. That senator's wife wasn't amused.
He rummages around under the bar for a minute, then blows the dust off a tiny piano, about nine inches tall.
Here, you can keep the piano, so long as you don't ask me about the trick.

intro: Oh, hello again. Thank you for telling me about this place. The locals have been very welcoming.
Oh, and I never really thanked you properly for saving my life, so thank you. Although I still don't really understand what happened.
I don't think I could explain it if I tried. And you're welcome.
neighbor: A hot dog vendor moved in next door, and asked if could find a cookbook for him.
A tanner moved in next door, and was looking for a book about the trade.
A strange fellow selling antiques moved in next door and was looking for books about "arcane secrets". I'm not sure what he meant by that, but I found one he seemed happy with.
A bootmaker moved in next door and was looking for something boot-focused. Kind of a weird request, but I managed to find him a book about kicking.
A brewery moved in next door, which is helping me deal with being more than a decade out of date on current events. He likes modern adventure fiction, so it wasn't hard to find him something.
I've got an extra copy of it, if you're interested.

intro: Oh, hey. Hi. Nice to see you again.
Heya. Did your elves make the trip okay?
Oh sure, yeah. No problems like, at all. I've been seeing them less and less since the move, though, so I've been making some boots myself, just to help them out.
Well, that's real nice of you.
neighbor: A guy moved in next door, selling hot dogs? So I figured I'd see if I could use his leftovers for boots? It's a little weird, but...
A tanner moved in next door, so I got some, like, super-thick leather? For soles, you know? See what you think.
A real weird guy moved in next door, he sold me some crazy nails that were, like, super cold? I dunno how that works, but I used 'em in a pair of boots if you wanna check 'em out.

neighbor: The very same day a hot dog salesman moved in next door to me, I came into possession of an ancient ring with mysterious meat-detection powers!

You noticed the tanner that moved in next door to me? Well, the same day he arrived, I acquired a spool of magic-amplifying thread. If you were to embroider some pants with it, the results could be quite powerful!

Have you met the bootmaker next door? I wasn't inclined to believe his stories about elves, but this morning I found a very interesting little hat on my doorstep, where my milk delivery was supposed to be!
Have you met the charming young lady who runs the bookshop next door? The very day she moved in, I received a package from a contact of mine -- a mysterious painting!

I've been working for several years on constructing a magical artifact of my own devising, and the same day the brewer moved in next door, I finally hit on the inspiration I required to finish it! It didn't even take very many bottles!

She picks some more bones out of those scattered on the floor -- ribs, finger bones, fragments of skull, more teeth -- and carefully sorts them on her workbench. You can't really see what happens after that, because you'd have to actually look over her shoulder, and it seems like a bad idea to disturb her.
